sub_title: Chief Technology and Innovation Officer | Innovation Domain Manager PNT Infrastructures and Solutions
summary:
My multi-disciplinary knowledge and experience embrace system engineering in all space branches (EO, navigation, telecommunications and science), electromagnetism and quantum physics, communication theory, and astrophysics. As team leader, I combine methodology, processes and expert knowledge with leadership and people management skills. 

I have always been exposed to industrial strategies and dynamics with customers, which has enriched my relationship with major stakeholders of the aerospace industry. 

Constantly heading to excellence and innovation and looking forward to more.

treasury_media.title: ESA Web-series Meet the Experts: Satellite Navigation
treasury_media.description: Satellite navigation is a big part of our daily lives. How do our phones and cars know where to go? Nicola De Quattro, head of engineering and innovation at Vitrociset Belgium, explains how sat nav works along with its present and future applications in this episode of Meet The Experts.

treasury_media.title: Nicola De Quattro - Switch 2 Space II October 2020 Topic 6
treasury_media.description: The presentation is a brief introduction to techniques for securing satellite communication infrastructure, targeting academic students or young professionals not familiar with space.

treasury_media.title: Switch to Space II October 2020 - Topic 6 Space Security and Defense
treasury_media.description: This topic addressed the major building blocks and the latest development linked to STM, Secure Communication, development of quantum technologies as well as the Geospatial Intelligence domain and the trending use of Artificial Intelligence in dealing with Emergency and Security Space services.

projects.title: CyTEF
projects.description:
With the growing spread in the use of UAVs for civil and military applications and in the increasing availability in the market of low-cost RF equipment, attacks are becoming more common and their impact more relevant, compromising both the security of drones operations and the safety of human beings.

The Cybersecurity Test & Evaluation Facility (CyTEF), is an infrastructure able to perform security and resilience tests on drones for what concerns attacks in the navigation, RF communication and cybersecurity domain. The CyTEF system is composed of attack generators controlled by a central orchestrator used by the operator that executes customisable attack scenarios, leveraging on the actuators available to apply the cyber-attacks. Once the attack is performed, the system allows the analysis of the effects on the drones and generates a Security assessment's report.

The aim is to build a proof-of-concept towards the realisation of a drones security qualification and certification centre for specific types of drones and specific applications. 

The industrial consortium, 100% Belgian, is constituted by:

RMA as Prime
Vitrociset Belgium
Rhea
M3Systems
AiRobot
Unifly

Vitrociset Belgium has two key roles in the project :
- Provide Project Management support to RMA, dealing especially with the technical coordination of the activities among all partners to ensure high quality, timeliness and cost-effectiveness in the project.
- On the technical involvement, it is the responsible of the overall system design and provides the Command, Control and Communication attack generator, developing a module for the RF attacks (jamming and spoofing).

The project is considered as the flagship of NAVISP Element 3, and it is of strategic relevance for Belgium, being the first facility of this type in Europe and one of the first to be developed in the world.

contributors.headline: Chief Technology and Innovation Officer | Innovation Domain Manager PNT Infrastructures and Solutions

projects.title: Galileo 2nd Generation
projects.description: Galileo Second Generation is the evolution of the currently under deployment Galileo First Generation System. The current system is at the time of writing approaching the FOC phase with the first operational satellites being deployed and the first services being validated. G2G aims at from one hand improving the currently defined system requirements taking into account new mission level needs, from the other at optimizing the FOC functionalities based on G1G lessons learnt. In particular, G2G will constitute the replenishment of the G1G system, and evolutions are expected on every system aspects. As such, it shall comply with G1G requirements while define new requirements for the evolution of the system.

contributors.headline: Chief Technology and Innovation Officer | Innovation Domain Manager PNT Infrastructures and Solutions

projects.title: ANTARES
projects.description: ANTARES (AeroNauTicAl REsources Satellite based) is the phase B study designing a new Satellite Communication System for Air Traffic Management, within the Iris programme (element 10 of ESA ARTES).

contributors.headline: Chief Technology and Innovation Officer | Innovation Domain Manager PNT Infrastructures and Solutions

projects.title: EGEP PCW
projects.description: EGEP PCW extension study is devoted to the embarkation of one or more piggy-back payloads on the CSA PCW main mission operating over polar regions. It is focused mainly on the analysis and definition of a Navigation Mission piggy-back payload aiming at extending the provision of EGNOS augmentation service over the Northern Europe and Polar area. An Aeronautical Communication and Broadband Communication piggy-back payload have been also studied as secondary missions.

contributors.headline: Chief Technology and Innovation Officer | Innovation Domain Manager PNT Infrastructures and Solutions

projects.title: SESAR
projects.description: The SESAR (Single European Sky ATM Research) programme is one of the most ambitious research and development projects ever launched by the European Union. The programme is the technological and operational dimension of the Single European Sky (SES)  initiative to meet future capacity and air safety needs.

profile_positions.title: Innovation Domain Manager - PNT Infrastructures and Solutions
Head of Innovation and Technology Governance

profile_positions.description:
I am in charge of the management, definition, coordination and execution of all strategic activities.
- Overseeing Engineering activities and defining priorities, including innovation and R&D
- Program management for engineering projects development
- Ensuring the fulfilment of the company targets associated with projects
- Managing and defining the technology and competences evolution policies
- Defining and implementing the company strategic roadmap for innovative products in coordination with the Telespazio Group strategy
- Defining and promoting strategic commercial and institutional partnership
- Supervising all project activities from a technical and management perspective
- Providing a management interface with project customers
